alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 01 at 4:00PM MST until January 01 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MST FOR PINAL COUNTY... At 359 PM MST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Boyce Thompson Arboretum, or over Superior, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Superior, Top Of The World, Boyce Thompson Arboretum and Top-Of-The-World. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 219 and 235. AZ Route 177 between mile markers 159 and 167. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
